nodes.bodyText: I don't like to have a pom inheriting from a child module. I think it could be better to make all modules directly inherit from  build-bom instead of kogito-runtimes. Wdyt?
Could you explain the reason for not liking it?

I think it is misleading to have a parent module that is not coherent with module hierarchy expecially when you have to add/remove properties or dependency.
But probably it is mainly because I find strange that build-bom is both my parent  and my child :)

well, this is not something new or too uncommon to maven project/world.
And build-bom is not actually child as it doesn't inherit the top level pom.xml just it is executed/called out from it.

Yes with child I meant child from a "file system" perspective.
Personally I prefer Quarkus (and OptaPlanner) setup that is a bit different:

build-parent: inherit from root pom
root pom: it is inheriting from jboss-parent while we want to be agnostic so no parent here
all other modules (i.e. core): inherit directly or not from build-parent

Btw no strong opinion and thanks for the PR because it is a step forward with project configuration :)

Yes with child I meant child from a "file system" perspective.
Personally I prefer Quarkus (and OptaPlanner) setup that is a bit different:
* [build-parent](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/build-parent/pom.xml#L5-L9): inherit from root pom

* [root pom](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/pom.xml#L6-L10): it is inheriting from jboss-parent while we want to be agnostic so no parent here


Do we really keep this not inheriting? I think this will be required for later, so I can bring this here too, thanks for pointing it up

* all other modules (i.e. [core](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/core/pom.xml#L5-L10)): inherit directly or not from `build-parent`


maybe they are not inheriting directly, but this is probably for a reason, it is not part of the build chain, just built as a leaf artifact in the repository?

Btw no strong opinion and thanks for the PR because it is a step forward with project configuration :)

That is fine to object with explaining why ;)
I synced up the kogito-bom also with filesystem as it is better to have it the same until there is some special need to name it differently.

   </pluginRepositories>

-    <url>https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-runtimes</url>
-  </scm>
-
-  <developers>
-    <developer>
-      <name>All developers are listed on the team website</name>
-      <url>http://kogito.kie.org/community/team.html</url>
-    </developer>
-  </developers>
-
   <modules>
-    <module>bom</module>
+    <module>build-bom</module>
+    <module>kogito-bom</module>

nodes.bodyText:
if we avoid BOM term as that now cotains not only depMgmt then it should be build-parent, thinking about it's not publicly consumable we can omit kogito suffix there, but that is just keep it simple. I am not prefering it one or another, just the artifactId should be the same with directory name.
So I would like to change it on top of your comment to:

kogito-build-parent
or
build-parent

WDYT? @cristianonicolai @danielezonca @ge0ffrey

+1 to keep consistency between folder name and artifactId.
I would go for kogito-build-parent.
I have no strong opinion, fine for me kogito-build-parent and +1 to keep folder and artifact name in sync
What is the reason of this change? Do we expect any benefit using jboss-parent as parent?

The jboss-parent sets all plugin versions. All jboss projects using it, including kie 7, optaplanner, quarkus, wildfly, ...
Forgetting to set one of the plugin versions causes non-reproducible builds.
Settings them ourselves is a PITA to keep them up to date. The jboss-parent guys do a pretty good job of keeping them up to date soon enough and without upgrading them too fast either.

please make sure these are all aligned with the changes in this diff
https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-runtimes/compare/4204fd29053e2d74948898532c3196af7497bf86..master#diff-600376dffeb79835ede4a0b285078036
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,1237 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
+
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
+    <artifactId>kogito-runtimes</artifactId>
+    <version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
+  </parent>
+
+  <artifactId>kogito-build-parent</artifactId>
+  <packaging>pom</packaging>
+
+  <name>Kogito Runtimes Build BOM</name>
+  <description>Kogito Runtimes Dependency Management Project BOM</description>
+
+  <properties>
+  <!-- plugin versions -->
+    <version.antapacheregexp>1.8.2</version.antapacheregexp>
+    <version.antrun.plugin>1.8</version.antrun.plugin>
+    <version.asciidoctor.plugin>1.5.2.1</version.asciidoctor.plugin>
+    <version.build.helper.plugin>3.0.0</version.build.helper.plugin>
+    <version.ch.qos.logback>1.1.3</version.ch.qos.logback>
+    <version.clean.plugin>3.1.0</version.clean.plugin>
+    <version.compiler.plugin>3.8.1</version.compiler.plugin>
+    <version.copyrename.plugin>1.0</version.copyrename.plugin>
+    <version.dependency.plugin>2.8</version.dependency.plugin>
+    <version.deploy.plugin>2.8.2</version.deploy.plugin>
+    <version.exec.plugin>1.6.0</version.exec.plugin>
+    <version.findbugs.plugin>3.0.5</version.findbugs.plugin>
+    <version.install.plugin>2.5.2</version.install.plugin>
+    <version.invoker.plugin>2.0.0</version.invoker.plugin>
+    <version.jacoco.plugin>0.8.5</version.jacoco.plugin>
+    <version.jandex.plugin>1.0.6</version.jandex.plugin>
+    <version.jar.plugin>3.1.0</version.jar.plugin>
+    <version.javadoc.plugin>3.0.1</version.javadoc.plugin>
+    <version.javancss.plugin>2.0</version.javancss.plugin>
+    <version.jdocbook.plugin>2.3.9</version.jdocbook.plugin>
+    <version.license.plugin>1.8.0</version.license.plugin>
+    <version.archetype.plugin>3.0.1</version.archetype.plugin>
+    <version.enforcer.plugin>3.0.0-M2</version.enforcer.plugin>
+    <version.maven>3.6.2</version.maven>
+    <version.maven.plugin>3.4</version.maven.plugin>
+    <version.native2ascii.plugin>1.0-beta-1</version.native2ascii.plugin>
+    <version.plexus>1.6</version.plexus>
+    <version.plexus.classworld>2.5.2</version.plexus.classworld>
+    <version.plugin.plugin>3.6.0</version.plugin.plugin>
+    <version.project.sources.plugin>0.3</version.project.sources.plugin>
+    <version.resources.plugin>3.1.0</version.resources.plugin>
+    <version.site.plugin>3.7.1</version.site.plugin>
+    <version.shade.plugin>3.0.0</version.shade.plugin>
+    <version.sonar.plugin>3.6.1.1688</version.sonar.plugin>
+    <version.source.plugin>3.0.1</version.source.plugin>
+    <version.surefire.plugin>2.22.2</version.surefire.plugin> <!-- minimum required by JUnit 5 -->
+    <version.surefire.report.plugin>2.6</version.surefire.report.plugin>
+    <version.swagger.plugin>2.1.0</version.swagger.plugin>
+    <version.taglist.plugin>2.4</version.taglist.plugin>
+    <version.versions.plugin>2.1</version.versions.plugin>
+    <version.jayway.jsonpath>2.4.0</version.jayway.jsonpath>
+
+    <!-- this version property is used in plugins but also in dependencies too -->
+    <version.io.quarkus>1.6.0.Final</version.io.quarkus>

nodes.bodyText: yes, master changes too fast for me
